vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀσφάλ-εια [φᾰ],
genitive ας, Ionic dialect ης, ἡ, (ἀσφᾰλής) security against stumbling or falling, ἀ. πρὸς τὸν πηλόν[Refs 5th c.BC+]; steadfastness, stability, ἀσφαλείᾳ.. ἀνόρθωσον πόλιν raise up the city so that it stand fast, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 assurance from danger, personal safety, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἀ. τῆς ἐπαναφορᾶς precaution regarding it, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἡ ἰδία ἀ., opposed to ὁ τῆς πόλεως κίνδυνος, [Refs 5th c.BC+]safe-conduct, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἀ. διδόναι, παρέχειν, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; τὸ σῶμ᾽ ἐν ἀσφαλείᾳ καθιστάναι, καθεστάναι, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; κατ᾽ ἀσφάλειαν in safety, [Refs 5th c.BC+]seasons of safety, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__3 caution, σῴζονται ὑπ᾽ ἀσφαλείας[Refs 1st c.AD+]: in Lit. Crit., circumspection, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__4 assurance, certainty, ἀ. πολλὴ μὴ ἂν ἐλθεῖν αὐτούς[Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἀ. ἐργάζεσθαι τὴν γῆν security for agriculture, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__5 ἀ. λόγου convincing nature, certainty of an argument, [NT]
__6 as law-term, security, bond, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; pledge, [Refs 1st c.BC+]: in plural, = Latin cautiones, [Refs 6th c.AD+]
__7 [Refs 4th c.BC+] name for eight, [Refs]
